channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish from Kung Fu Mama - all over the pavement. Outside collection hours., 4th November
item.description:
From early afternoon until late at night pavement is covered with their rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Drury Lane, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive speeding, 4th November
item.description:
Hello, I’ve had enough of vehicles speeding past my house on Flamstead End Road at ridiculously dangerous speeds and causing high levels of disruptive noise pollution from modified exhausts and engines. This road has become increasingly more busy and people treat it like a race track when in fact it’s heavily residential with shops and pedestrians using the road often. I take my kids to school daily and I’m so afraid of how fast vehicles travel through here. Please consider measures to reduce speeds (some in excess of 40mph) through our neighbourhood. Speed bumps, cameras or another set of traffic lights please, before someone is killed!!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Flamstead End Road, Broxbourne
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuously overflowing waste bins, 4th November
item.description:
Please can you add more bins here as thus is a recurring issue?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Caleb Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree has broken branches hanging, 4th November
item.description:
Tree has broken branches more than 3 big branches that have snapped completely off and have got caught in lower branches. A health and safety hazard as could just fall out at anytime. Also tree needs a trim.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rutland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 4th November
item.description:
Someone has left hazardous waste, including a fridge, a microwave and many furniture ( beds, sofas) near the fire's building exit on the side of Stockwell Rd.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Road, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog waste by lamppost on Merrow Street, 4th November
item.description:
Dog waste has been left by the lamppost in front of 9 Balmoral Court, on Merrow Street. I reported this a couple days ago but it's still there. There are several young kids on the street including my own so it would be good to clear it up for their safety. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merrow Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped fridge/freezer, 4th November
item.description:
A fridge/freezer has been dumped on the pavement on the Limes Avenue. It is outside the flats just before Limes Close on the same side of the road. Children walk along here to get to Our Lady of Lourdes School. It is blocking the pavement and is a hazard. I think it was put there today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, The Limes Avenue, New Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White van dumped asbestos roofing sheets, 4th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Duddington Close, Elmstead, London

item.title: Falling Leaves_Sutherland Road, Edmonton N9, 4th November
item.description:
Sutherland Road, Edmonton N9 pavements covered in falling leaves and litter which are wet and extremely slippery. Please can we get street cleaning team to sweep up and clear.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Sutherland Road, Edmonton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole in footbridge, 4th November
item.description:
I reported this the other week and your reply was that it was Network Rails problem. I contacted them and they say it is not their bridge and to contact Bromley Council!! I am really concerned that the whole bridge may be rusting and the job is being passed from one person to the next. Please can you confirm if the council is taking responsibility. Have attached screenshot of Network Rails problem reply.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ivy Bridge, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of rubbish left on pavement everyday, 4th November
item.description:
Large pile of rubbish is regularly left on the pavement in the way of pedestrians by a sign post. Not the correct area for leaving waste.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-12, Berners Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Litter and leaves, 4th November
item.description:
I wrote yesterday advising of litter and leaves on our street, today you advised it’s ‘resolved’ but nothing has been done. Terrible service. See photos attached. Please sort it out and implement a long term solution this has been a problem for months.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tottenham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
